availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Travis S. Graddy (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Tracey Graddy. Married to Sarah F. Graddy. Father of Washington C. Graddy, B. J. Graddy, and Margaret E. Graddy. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 73B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 687.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 752-53.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 216A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, July 1863, p. 9.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hopkins County Administrators Bonds, 1899-1907, p. 214.
